title: Highest CO2 Emissions from Land Use
description: In 2022, Indonesia had the highest carbon dioxide net fluxes from land use, land-use change, and forestry, excluding non-tropical fires, amounting to 924.85 Mt CO2e.

title: Lowest Percentage of Trained Preprimary Teachers
description: In 2023, only 3.22% of preprimary teachers in Indonesia were trained, the lowest percentage globally.

title: Highest Prevalence of Tobacco Use Among Males
description: In 2022, 73.1% of male adults in Indonesia were current tobacco users, the highest prevalence in the world.
